source: "We now have 4-month-old mice that are non-diabetic that used to be diabetic," he added.
hypothesis: Ya kara da cewa: "Yanzu muna da beraye masu wata huɗu da ba su da ciwon sukari, kuma a dā suna da ciwon sukari".
corrected_ref: “Yanzu muna bera mai watanni 4 wadanda ba su da ciwon sukari ba wadanda ke da suke fama da ciwon sukari,” in ji shi.
justification: The MT Hypothesis provides an accurate and fluent translation of the source text. It correctly renders 'mice' as plural ('beraye') and accurately conveys '4-month-old' ('masu wata huɗu') and 'used to be diabetic' ('kuma a dā suna da ciwon sukari'). The placement of the reported speech ('Ya kara da cewa:') is also idiomatic in Hausa. The provided 'Correct Reference' has issues with number agreement ('bera' for 'mice') and less accurate phrasing for 'used to be diabetic' ('suke fama' implying current suffering), making the MT Hypothesis a more faithful translation.

source: Dr. Ehud Ur, professor of medicine at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia and chair of the clinical and scientific division of the Canadian Diabetes Association cautioned that the research is still in its early days.
hypothesis: Dokta Ehud Ur, farfesa a jami'ar Dalhousie da ke Halifax, Nova Scotia kuma shugaban sashen kula da cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan da cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtukan cututtuka.
corrected_ref: Dokta Ehud Ur, farfesan magani a Jami’ar Dalhousie da ke Halifax, Nova Scotia kuma shugaban sashen likitanci da bangaren kimiyya na kungiyar masu ciwon sikari ta Kanada ya yi gargadin cewa har yanzu binciken yana kan farkonsa.
justification: The MT hypothesis contains an extreme and repetitive error in the translation of 'clinical and scientific division', rendering the sentence completely unintelligible. The phrase 'cututtukan cututtukan' (meaning 'diseases of diseases') is repeated excessively, leading to total loss of meaning and fluency.

source: Like some other experts, he is skeptical about whether diabetes can be cured, noting that these findings have no relevance to people who already have Type 1 diabetes.
hypothesis: Kamar wasu masana, yana da shakku game da ko za a iya warkar da ciwon sukari, yana lura cewa waɗannan binciken ba su da amfani ga mutanen da suke da ciwon sukari na Type 1.
corrected_ref: Kamar wasu ƙwararrun, yana da shakkun cewa ko za a iya warkar da ciwon sukari, inda ya bayyana cewa sakamakon bincike ba shi da alaƙa da mutanen da tuni su ke da nau’in ciwon sukari na 1.
justification: The MT mistranslates 'have no relevance' as 'ba su da amfani' (have no use/are useless), which significantly alters the original meaning. The correct translation should convey 'no relation' or 'no relevance' (e.g., 'ba shi da alaƙa'). Additionally, the MT omits the word 'already' from 'people who already have Type 1 diabetes,' which impacts the completeness and nuance of the sentence. The phrasing for 'noting that' ('yana lura cewa') is also less idiomatic than the reference's 'inda ya bayyana cewa' for this context.

source: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.
hypothesis: A ranar Litinin, Sara Danius, sakatare na dindindin na Kwamitin Nobel don Adabi a Kwalejin Sweden, ta sanar a fili a lokacin wani shirin rediyo a Sveriges Radio a Sweden kwamitin, ba zai iya tuntuɓar Bob Dylan kai tsaye game da lashe kyautar Nobel na Adabi ta 2016, ya watsar da ƙoƙarinsa don isa gare shi.
corrected_ref: A ranar Litinin, Sara Danius, sakatariyar dindindin ta Kwamitin Adabi na kungiyar nagartattu a Kwalejin Nazarin Sweden, ta sanar a bainar jama'a yayin wani shirin rediyo a Sveriges Radio a Sweden kwamitin, ba zai iya kaiwa ga Bob Dylan kai tsaye ba game da lashe kyautar Nobel ta 2016 a Adabi, ta yi watsi da ita kokarinta na isa gare shi.
justification: The MT uses the masculine form 'sakatare na dindindin' for 'permanent secretary' when referring to Sara Danius, who is female. The correct feminine form 'sakatariyar dindindin' should have been used for proper gender agreement.

source: Danius said, "Right now we are doing nothing. I have called and sent emails to his closest collaborator and received very friendly replies. For now, that is certainly enough."
hypothesis: Danius ya ce, "A yanzu ba mu yi kome ba. Na kira kuma na aika imel zuwa ga abokin aikinsa mafi kusa kuma na karɓi amsoshi masu kyau. A yanzu, wannan ya isa".
corrected_ref: Danius ya ce, “Yanzu haka ba mwa yin komi. Na kira na kuma aika emails zuwa abokan aikinsa na kusa na kuma anshi amsoshi masu kyau. A yanzu haka, wannan bai isa ba.”
justification: The MT incorrectly translates 'we are doing nothing' (present continuous) as 'we did nothing' (past tense: 'ba mu yi kome ba'). The correct reference 'ba mwa yin komi' accurately conveys the present continuous tense.

source: Previously, Ring's CEO, Jamie Siminoff, remarked the company started when his doorbell wasn't audible from his shop in his garage.
hypothesis: A baya, Shugaba na Ring, Jamie Siminoff, ya lura da kamfanin ya fara ne lokacin da ba a ji kararrawar kofarsa daga shagonsa a garejinsa.
corrected_ref: A baya, Shugaban kamfanin Ring, Jamie Siminoff, ya bayyana cewa kamfanin ya fara lokacin da ba a jiyo sauti kararrawar jikin ƙofar sa daga shagonsa a cikin garejinsa.
justification: The MT incorrectly translated 'remarked' as 'ya lura da' (noticed/observed) instead of 'ya bayyana cewa' (stated/declared), which significantly alters the original meaning of the sentence. Additionally, the translation for 'wasn't audible' ('ba a ji') is less precise than the reference's 'ba a jiyo sauti' which better conveys audibility.

source: He built a WiFi door bell, he said.
hypothesis: Ya ce ya gina ƙofar ƙofar WiFi, ya ce.
corrected_ref: Ya ce, ya gina ƙararrawar ƙofa ta WiFi.
justification: The MT translated "door bell" as "ƙofar ƙofar" (door door), which is an incorrect translation that fundamentally alters the meaning of the object built. The correct term for "doorbell" in Hausa is "ƙararrawar ƙofa". Additionally, the phrase "ya ce" is repeated unnecessarily, affecting the fluency and naturalness of the sentence.

source: Siminoff said sales boosted after his 2013 appearance in a Shark Tank episode where the show panel declined funding the startup.
hypothesis: Siminoff ya ce tallace-tallace sun karu bayan fitowarsa a 2013 a cikin wani labarin Shark Tank inda kwamitin wasan kwaikwayon ya ƙi tallafawa farawa.
corrected_ref: Siminoff yace ciniki ya karu baya futuwar sa ta 2013 a shinrin wasan kwaikwayin Shark Tank inda masu shirin suka ki biyan kudin sabuwar sana'ar.
justification: The MT translates "episode" as "labarin" which means "story" or "news article". The correct term for an episode of a TV show would be "shirin" or "kashi" as used in the reference ("shirin wasan kwaikwayon"), making the MT's choice inappropriate for the context.

source: In late 2017, Siminoff appeared on shopping television channel QVC.
hypothesis: A ƙarshen 2017, Siminoff ya bayyana a tashar talabijin ta QVC.
corrected_ref: A ƙarshen 2017, Siminoff ya bayyana a tashar telebijin mai sayarwa ta QVC.
justification: The MT hypothesis omits the translation for 'shopping' (mai sayarwa) when describing the television channel. The source specifies it as a 'shopping television channel,' but the MT translates it simply as 'television channel,' which loses a key semantic detail about the channel's purpose.

source: Ring also settled a lawsuit with competing security company, the ADT Corporation.
hypothesis: Ring kuma ya warware karar da kamfanin tsaro mai fafatawa, ADT Corporation.
corrected_ref: Ring ta kuma sasanta takardar kotu tsakanin wata kamfanin adawa na tsaro wato ADT Corporation.
justification: The MT uses the masculine pronoun 'ya' instead of the correct feminine 'ta' for 'Ring' (a company/entity), which is a grammatical agreement error. Additionally, the verb 'warware' (resolved) is less precise for 'settled a lawsuit' than 'sasanta' (reconciled/settled a dispute) as used in the reference. The phrasing 'karar da kamfanin tsaro' is also less idiomatic and precise than 'takardar kotu tsakanin wata kamfanin adawa na tsaro' for this context.

source: "We now have 4-month-old mice that are non-diabetic that used to be diabetic," he added.
hypothesis: O okeditše ka gore: "Ga bjale re na le diphošo tša dikgwedi tše 4 tšeo di se nago le bolwetši bja swikiri tšeo pele di bego di na le bolwetši bja swikiri".
corrected_ref: Re na gabjale le magotlwana a kgwedi-tše-4 ao a se nago bolwetši bja sukiri ao a bego a na le bolwetši bja sukiri, o okeditše.
justification: The machine translation incorrectly translates 'mice' as 'diphošo' (errors/mistakes/flies) instead of the correct 'magotlwana' (mice). This is a critical lexical error that fundamentally changes the meaning of the sentence. As a result, the subsequent pronoun agreement ('tšeo' instead of 'ao') is also incorrect.

source: Dr. Ehud Ur, professor of medicine at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia and chair of the clinical and scientific division of the Canadian Diabetes Association cautioned that the research is still in its early days.
hypothesis: Dr. Ehud Ur, moprofesara wa tša kalafo Yunibesithing ya Dalhousie kua Halifax, Nova Scotia gomme e le modulasetulo wa karolo ya tša kalafo le tša thutamahlale ya Mokgatlo wa Badudi ba Swikiri wa Canada o lemošitše gore nyakišišo e sa le matšatšing a yona a mathomo.
corrected_ref: Dr. Ehud Ur, moprofesara wa tša maphelo Yunibesithing ya Dalhousie ka Halifax, Nova Scotia le modulasetulo wa karolo ya maphelo le mahlale wa Mokgahlo wa Bolwetši bja Swikiri wa Canada ba lemošitše gore nyakišišo e sa le matšatšing a pele.
justification: The MT mistranslates 'Canadian Diabetes Association' as 'Mokgatlo wa Badudi ba Swikiri wa Canada' (Association of People with Diabetes), which semantically shifts the focus from the disease itself to the people affected by it, unlike the more accurate 'Mokgahlo wa Bolwetši bja Swikiri' (Association of Diabetes Disease) in the reference. Additionally, the MT uses more verbose phrases like 'tša thutamahlale' for 'scientific' and 'matšatšing a yona a mathomo' for 'in its early days', which are less concise and idiomatic than 'mahlale' and 'matšatšing a pele' in the reference, indicating fluency and word choice issues. However, the MT correctly maintains the singular subject pronoun 'o' for 'cautioned', matching the source, unlike the plural 'ba' in the provided reference.

source: Like some other experts, he is skeptical about whether diabetes can be cured, noting that these findings have no relevance to people who already have Type 1 diabetes.
hypothesis: Go swana le ditsebi tše dingwe, o belaela ge e ba bolwetši bja swikiri bo ka fodišwa, a bolela gore dilo tše di hweditšwego ga di na taba le batho bao ba šetšego ba e-na le bolwetši bja swikiri bja mohuta wa 1.
corrected_ref: Bjalo ka ditsebi tše dingwe, o gonona gore ekaba diabetes e ka fodišwa, a bolela gore dikarabo tše ga di bolele ka batho bao ba šetšego ba na le Type 1 diabetes.
justification: The MT Hypothesis is a fluent and accurate translation of the source text. All key phrases are correctly rendered. Differences from the reference, such as 'Go swana le' vs 'Bjalo ka' (both meaning 'like'), 'belaela' vs 'gonona' (both meaning 'skeptical/doubt'), 'dilo tše di hweditšwego' (things found) vs 'dikarabo tše' (answers/results) for 'findings', and translating 'diabetes' vs retaining the English term, are stylistic choices and do not constitute errors. The MT's choices are natural and correct in Sepedi.

source: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.
hypothesis: Ka Mošupologo, Sara Danius, mongwaledi wa go ya go ile wa Komiti ya Nobel ya Mangwalo ya Swedish Academy, o tsebišitše phatlalatša nakong ya lenaneo la radio go Sveriges Radio kua Sweden gore komiti ye, ka ge e sa kgone go fihlelela Bob Dylan ka go lebanya mabapi le go thopa Moputso wa Nobel wa 2016 wa Mangwalo, e tlogetše maiteko a yona a go fihla go yena.
corrected_ref: Ka Mošupulogo, Sara Danius, mongwaledi wa goya goile wa Komiti ye Kgethwa ya Dipuku ka Akhatemi ya Swedish, o tsebišitše seyalemoyeng phatlatlatša go Seyalemoya sa Sveriges ka Sweden, a palelwa ke go fihlelela Bob Dylan thwii mabapi le go thopa Sefoka sa 2016 ka Dipuku, o tlogetše maitapišo a yona go mo fihlelela.
justification: The MT Hypothesis contains several significant semantic deviations from the provided Correct Reference. Firstly, it translates 'Nobel Committee for Literature' as 'Komiti ya Nobel ya Mangwalo' and '2016 Nobel Prize in Literature' as 'Moputso wa Nobel wa 2016 wa Mangwalo', while the reference uses 'Komiti ye Kgethwa ya Dipuku' and 'Sefoka sa 2016 ka Dipuku' respectively. This alters the specific identity of the committee and the prize. Secondly and more critically, the MT attributes the inability to reach Bob Dylan and the abandonment of efforts to the 'committee' ('komiti ye... e sa kgone... e tlogetše'), whereas the reference attributes these actions to Sara Danius ('a palelwa ke... o tlogetše'). This constitutes a fundamental change in the subject performing the actions, leading to a significant meaning alteration relative to the reference.

source: Danius said, "Right now we are doing nothing. I have called and sent emails to his closest collaborator and received very friendly replies. For now, that is certainly enough."
hypothesis: Danius o itše, "Ga bjale ga re dire selo. Ke ile ka bitša le go romela melaetša ya elektroniki go mošomišani wa gagwe wa kgaufsi kudu gomme ka amogela dikarabo tše borutho kudu.
corrected_ref: Danius o boletše gore, "Gabjale ga re dire selo. Ke leditše le go romela diimeile go modirišanimmogo le yena gomme ka amogela diphetolo tše dibotse. Gabjale, seo se lekane."
justification: The MT entirely omits the final sentence, "For now, that is certainly enough." This significantly alters the overall meaning of the source text. Additionally, the MT uses "o itše" for "said," which is less complete than the more idiomatic "o boletše gore" for reported speech in the reference. It also uses the more verbose "melaetša ya elektroniki" for "emails" instead of the more concise "diimeile" from the reference.

source: Previously, Ring's CEO, Jamie Siminoff, remarked the company started when his doorbell wasn't audible from his shop in his garage.
hypothesis: Pejana, CEO wa Ring, Jamie Siminoff, o ile a bolela gore khamphani e thomile ge lenaka la gagwe la mojako le be le sa kwewe lebenkeleng la gagwe ka karatšheng ya gagwe.
corrected_ref: Nako ya go feta, CEO ya Ring, Jamie Siminoff, o lemogile gore khampane e thomile ge tšhipi ya gagwe ya mojako e be e sa kwagale go tšwa lebenkeleng la gagwe ka karatšeng ya gagwe.
justification: The MT contains several errors that alter the meaning of the source. Firstly, 'lenaka la mojako' (door horn) was used instead of the correct term 'tšhipi ya mojako' (doorbell). Secondly, 'le be le sa kwewe' (it was not heard - passive) was used instead of 'e be e sa kwagale' (it was not audible), failing to accurately convey 'wasn't audible'. Thirdly, the preposition 'from' ('go tšwa') was omitted before 'his shop', making it read 'in his shop' instead of 'from his shop'.

source: He built a WiFi door bell, he said.
hypothesis: O itše o ile a aga lelokelelo la mojako la Wi-Fi.
corrected_ref: O ile a aga tšhipi ya gagwe ya mojako ya WiFi, ge a bolela.
justification: The MT translates 'door bell' as 'lelokelelo la mojako' which means 'door circuit' or 'door system'. This is an incorrect lexical choice. The correct term is 'tšhipi ya mojako', meaning 'door bell' or 'door chime', as seen in the reference. This changes the specific item that was built.

source: Siminoff said sales boosted after his 2013 appearance in a Shark Tank episode where the show panel declined funding the startup.
hypothesis: Siminoff o boletše gore dithekišo di ile tša oketšega ka morago ga go tšwelela ga gagwe ka 2013 ka go seripa sa Shark Tank moo sehlopha sa lenaneo se ilego sa gana go thekga go thoma.
corrected_ref: Siminoff e rile dithekišo di ile godimo ka morago ga go tšwelelela ga gagwe ka 2013 karolong ya Shark Tank moo phanele ya lenaneo e gannego go tsenya mašeleng gore e thome kgwebo.
justification: The MT mistranslates 'funding the startup' as 'go thekga go thoma' (to support the start), which loses the specific financial meaning of 'funding' and uses a very generic term for 'startup'. The reference's translation 'go tsenya mašeleng gore e thome kgwebo' (to invest money so it starts a business) is much more accurate. Additionally, 'seripa' is a less precise word choice for 'episode' than 'karolo', and 'sehlopha' is less accurate than 'phanele' for 'panel'.

source: In late 2017, Siminoff appeared on shopping television channel QVC.
hypothesis: Go ya mafelelong a 2017, Siminoff o ile a tšwelela go thelebišene ya mabenkele ya QVC.
corrected_ref: Go ya mafelelong a 2017, Siminoff o tšweletše kgašong ya telebišene tšhaneleng ya QVC.
justification: The MT hypothesis translates "shopping television channel QVC" as "thelebišene ya mabenkele ya QVC" (shopping television of QVC). It omits the explicit translation of "channel", which is present in the source and correctly translated as "tšhaneleng" in the reference. While the meaning is generally understood, the omission makes the translation less precise and complete lexically.

source: Ring also settled a lawsuit with competing security company, the ADT Corporation.
hypothesis: Ring gape o ile a rarolla molato le khamphani ya tšhireletšo yeo e phadišanago, ADT Corporation.
corrected_ref: Ring o ile a rarolla gape molato le khampani ye e phadišanago ya tšhireletšo, ADT Corporation.
justification: The adverb 'gape' (also) is misplaced in the MT hypothesis. In Nso, for this context, 'gape' should generally follow the verb it modifies, 'rarolla' (settled), as demonstrated in the correct reference. Placing it immediately after the subject 'Ring' is less natural and grammatically awkward.

source: "We now have 4-month-old mice that are non-diabetic that used to be diabetic," he added.
hypothesis: U engeterile: "Sweswi hi ni makondlo lama nga ni tin'hweti ta mune lama nga riki na vuvabyi bya chukele lama tshameke ma va ni vuvabyi bya chukele".
corrected_ref: Sweswi hi ni makondlo lama nga ni tin'hweti ta mune lama nga riki na vuvabyi bya chukele kambe khale a ma ri na byona".
justification: The MT hypothesis repeats the phrase 'vuvabyi bya chukele' (diabetes) in the latter part of the sentence, which makes it less natural and fluent. The correct reference uses a pronoun 'byona' to avoid this repetition, resulting in better style and flow.

source: Dr. Ehud Ur, professor of medicine at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia and chair of the clinical and scientific division of the Canadian Diabetes Association cautioned that the research is still in its early days.
hypothesis: Dok. Ehud Ur, profesa wa vutshunguri eYunivhesiti ya Dalhousie eHalifax, le Nova Scotia tlhelo mutshama-xitulu wa ndzawulo ya swa vutshunguri ni sayense ya Canadian Diabetes Association u tsundzuxile leswaku ndzavisiso lowu wa ha ri emasikwini ya wona yo sungula.
corrected_ref: Muongori Ehud Ur, phurofesa wa vutshunguri eYunivhesiti ya Dalhousie eHalifax, Nova Scotia tlhelo mutshamaxitulu wa xiyenge xa vuongori na sayense eka Canadian Diabetes Association u lemukise leswaku ndzavisiso wa ha ri emasungulweni.
justification: The MT's translation of 'cautioned' as 'u tsundzuxile' (reminded/advised) slightly alters the nuance of the source, which implies a stronger warning. The correct reference uses 'u lemukise' (cautioned/warned), which is semantically more accurate. Additionally, the phrase 'in its early days' was translated very literally as 'emasikwini ya wona yo sungula' instead of the more idiomatic 'emasungulweni' used in the reference, impacting fluency.

source: Like some other experts, he is skeptical about whether diabetes can be cured, noting that these findings have no relevance to people who already have Type 1 diabetes.
hypothesis: Ku fana ni vativi van'wana, wa kanakana loko vuvabyi bya chukele byi nga tshunguleka, a vula leswaku leswi kumiweke a swi na mhaka ni vanhu lava ana se va nga ni vuvabyi bya chukele bya Type 1.
corrected_ref: Ku fana ni vativi van’wana, a nga tiyiseki kahle leswaku vuvabyi bya chukela byi nga tshunguleka, u vula leswaku leswi kumiweke a swi va khumbi vanhu lava va nga ni vuvabyi bya chukela bya muxaka wo sungula
justification: The MT's translation of 'have no relevance to people' as 'a swi na mhaka ni vanhu' (it has no concern/matter with people) is less natural and precise than the reference's 'a swi va khumbi vanhu' (it does not affect/concern them, the people). The MT's phrasing is somewhat awkward and does not convey the nuance of 'relevance' as effectively as the reference.

source: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.
hypothesis: Hi Musumbhunuku, Sara Danius, matsalana wa nkarhi hinkwawo wa Komiti ya Nobel ya Tibuku ya le Swedish Academy, u tivise erivaleni hi nkarhi wa nongonoko wa xiya-ni-moya eka Sveriges Radio eSweden leswaku komiti leyi, leyi tsandzekeke ku fikelela Bob Dylan hi ku kongoma malunghana ni ku kuma Sagwadi ra Nobel ra 2016 ra Tibuku, yi tshike matshalatshala ya yona yo n'wi fikelela.
corrected_ref: Hi Musumbhunuku, Sara Danius, matsalana wa nkarhi hinkwawo wa Komiti ya Nobel eka Matsalwa le Swedish Academy, u tivisile erivaleni eka nongonoko wa xiyanimoya eka Sveriges Radio le Sweden a vula leswaku komiti, tanihi leswi a yi nga swi koti ku fikelela Bob Dylan hi ku kongoma malunghana ni ku hlula kakwe Sagwadi ra Nobel eka Matsalwa hi 2016, yi tshikile matshalatshala lawa a yi ma endla yo n’wi kuma.
justification: The MT incorrectly translates 'Nobel Prize in Literature' as 'Sagwadi ra Nobel ra Tibuku' (Nobel Prize of Books) in two instances, whereas the correct term 'Matsalwa' (Literature/Writings) should have been used. Furthermore, 'about winning' is translated as 'malunghana ni ku kuma' (concerning receiving/getting) instead of 'malunghana ni ku hlula kakwe' (concerning his winning), which alters the intended meaning. The MT also loses some nuance in translating 'had abandoned its efforts' by using 'yi tshike matshalatshala ya yona' (it abandoned its efforts) which is less precise than 'yi tshikile matshalatshala lawa a yi ma endla' (it had abandoned the efforts it was making) from the reference, thus affecting the temporal aspect and completeness.

source: Danius said, "Right now we are doing nothing. I have called and sent emails to his closest collaborator and received very friendly replies. For now, that is certainly enough."
hypothesis: Danius u te: "Sweswi a hi endli nchumu. Ndzi bele munghana wakwe wa le kusuhi riqingho ndzi n'wi rhumela ti-e-mail naswona ndzi kume tinhlamulo leti nga ni xinghana.
corrected_ref: Danius u te, "Sweswi a hi endli nchumu. Ndzi be riqingho ndzi tlhela ndzi rhumela tiimeyili  eka mutirhi-kulobye lonkulu naswona ndzi kume tinhlamulo ta xinghana. Swa sweswi, sweswo swi ringene".
justification: The MT hypothesis contains two significant errors: 1. It incorrectly translates 'closest collaborator' as 'munghana wakwe wa le kusuhi' (his closest friend), which is a lexical error that changes the meaning. The correct term for 'collaborator' is 'mutirhi-kulobye'. 2. It completely omits the last sentence 'For now, that is certainly enough,' leading to a loss of information and impacting the overall meaning.

source: Previously, Ring's CEO, Jamie Siminoff, remarked the company started when his doorbell wasn't audible from his shop in his garage.
hypothesis: Eku sunguleni, CEO wa Ring, Jamie Siminoff, u vule leswaku khampani yi sungule loko riqingho ra yena ri nga twiwi exitolo xakwe egaraji.
corrected_ref: Enkarhini lowu hundzeke, CEO ya Ring, Jamie Siminoff, u vule leswaku khampani yi sungule enkarhini lowu bele rakwe ra le nyangweni a ri nga twali kahle loko a ri exitolo lexi a xi ri agarajini yakwe.
justification: The MT incorrectly translates "wasn't audible from his shop in his garage." The phrase "ri nga twiwi exitolo xakwe egaraji" translates to "was not heard at/in his shop in his garage," which deviates from the source's meaning of the doorbell not being audible *from the perspective of being inside the shop*. The reference correctly conveys this perspective by focusing on the CEO's location: "loko a ri exitolo lexi a xi ri agarajini yakwe" (when he was in the shop that was in his garage). Additionally, the MT uses less precise terms for "Previously" (Eku sunguleni vs. Enkarhini lowu hundzeke) and "doorbell" (riqingho ra yena vs. bele rakwe ra le nyangweni), and "wasn't audible" (ri nga twiwi vs. a ri nga twali kahle).

source: He built a WiFi door bell, he said.
hypothesis: U vule leswaku u ake bele ya nyangwa ya WiFi.
corrected_ref: U ri, u endle bele ra le nyangweni ra WiFi.
justification: The MT incorrectly transforms the reporting clause 'he said' into an integrated indirect speech construction ('U vule leswaku u ake...' - 'He said that he built...'), which alters the original sentence structure. The source places the reporting clause at the end of the statement, which is better reflected by the reference's 'U ri, u endle...'. Additionally, the translation of 'door bell' as 'bele ya nyangwa' (bell of door) is less idiomatic and grammatically less precise than 'bele ra le nyangweni' (bell at the door), which uses a locative construction. The verb choice of 'aka' (to build, often for large structures) is also less suitable than 'endla' (to make/do) for a doorbell.

source: Siminoff said sales boosted after his 2013 appearance in a Shark Tank episode where the show panel declined funding the startup.
hypothesis: Siminoff u vule leswaku ku xaviwa ka swilo swi tlakukile endzhaku ka loko a humelele eka nkombiso wa Shark Tank hi 2013 laha ntlawa wa vaxavisi wu aleke ku seketela ntirho lowu.
corrected_ref: Siminoff u vule leswaku minxavo yi tlakukile hi 2013 endzhaku ka loko a humelerile eka nongonoko wa Shark Tank laha vafambisi va nongonoko va aleke ku hakelela masungulo ya kona.
justification: The MT contains several incorrect word choices that lead to a significant distortion of the source's meaning. Specifically, 'sales' is translated imprecisely as 'ku xaviwa ka swilo' (the act of buying things) instead of 'minxavo' (sales/revenue); 'show panel' is incorrectly rendered as 'ntlawa wa vaxavisi' (group of buyers/sellers) instead of referring to the investor panel; 'funding' is generalized to 'ku seketela' (to support) instead of 'ku hakelela' (to fund); and 'the startup' is translated as 'ntirho lowu' (this work/endeavor) instead of a more specific term like 'masungulo ya kona' (its startup/beginnings). These collective errors alter the core message about who was involved and what transpired.

source: In late 2017, Siminoff appeared on shopping television channel QVC.
hypothesis: Eku heleni ka 2017, Siminoff u humelele eka xitichi xa thelevhixini xa ku xava xa QVC.
corrected_ref: Eku heleni ka 2017, Siminoff u humelerile eka nongonoko wa thelevhixini yo xava ya QVC.
justification: The MT translates "channel" as "xitichi" (channel/station), while the Correct Reference uses "nongonoko" (programme/show). Although "xitichi" is a direct translation of "channel", the reference suggests that "nongonoko" is the more appropriate and nuanced meaning for someone appearing on a shopping television channel, implying appearance on a specific broadcast segment. This results in a semantic difference regarding what Siminoff appeared on. Additionally, the MT uses "humelele" for "appeared," while "humelerile" (used in the Correct Reference) is generally considered a more precise and preferred form for the perfect tense of 'to appear' in Xitsonga, avoiding potential ambiguity with 'succeeded'.

source: Ring also settled a lawsuit with competing security company, the ADT Corporation.
hypothesis: Ring u tlhele a lulamisa nandzu lowu a wu ri ni khampani yin'wana ya vuhlayiseki leyi a yi phikizana na yena, ku nga ADT Corporation.
corrected_ref: Ring yi tlhele yi lulamisa nandzu lowu a wu khumba khampani ya vusirheleri leyi a yi phikizana na yona, ku nga ADT Corporation.
justification: The MT contains significant grammatical errors. The subject concord for 'Ring' (a company) is incorrect, using 'u' (class 1, for people) instead of 'yi' (class 9). Similarly, the object pronoun 'yena' (class 1) is used instead of 'yona' (class 9) when referring back to 'Ring'. Additionally, the MT incorrectly adds 'yin'wana' (another), which subtly alters the original meaning of the source text, and uses 'vuhlayiseki' instead of the more appropriate 'vusirheleri' for 'security' in this context.

source: "We now have 4-month-old mice that are non-diabetic that used to be diabetic," he added.
hypothesis: Wanezela: "Manje sinamagundane anenyanga ezine ubudala angenawo isifo sikashukela ayevame ukuba nesifo sikashukela".
corrected_ref: "Manje sinamagundane anezinyanga ezingu-4 angenawo ushukela ayenoshukela," wanezela.
justification: The MT's translation of '4-month-old' as 'anenyanga ezine ubudala' contains a grammatical error. 'Inyanga' (month) is singular, but 'ezine' (four) requires the plural form 'izinyanga'. It should be 'anezinyanga ezine' or 'anezinyanga ezingu-4'. Additionally, 'ubudala' (age) is redundant and less idiomatic when specifying the age of animals in months. The placement of 'Wanezela:' at the beginning of the quote also deviates from the source's 'he added' at the end, impacting the natural flow in Zulu.

source: Dr. Ehud Ur, professor of medicine at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia and chair of the clinical and scientific division of the Canadian Diabetes Association cautioned that the research is still in its early days.
hypothesis: UDkt. Ehud Ur, uprofesa wezokwelapha eDalhousie University eHalifax, eNova Scotia futhi ongusihlalo womnyango wezokwelapha nowesayensi weCanadian Diabetes Association waxwayisa ngokuthi ucwaningo lusesezinsukwini zalo zokuqala.
corrected_ref: UDkt. Ehud Ur, usolwazi wezokwelapha eNyuvesi yaseDalhousie eHalifax, eNova Scotia kanye nosihlalo womnyango wezokwelapha nowesayensi weCanadian Diabetes Association uxwayise ngokuthi ucwaningo lusanda kuqala.
justification: The translation of "Dalhousie University" as "eDalhousie University" is less idiomatic; the reference's "eNyuvesi yaseDalhousie" is more natural. Additionally, the phrase "is still in its early days" is translated very literally in the MT as "lusesezinsukwini zalo zokuqala". While understandable, this is less fluent and natural compared to the idiomatic "lusanda kuqala" (has just started/is still new) provided in the reference, which better captures the nuance of something being in its initial stages.

source: Like some other experts, he is skeptical about whether diabetes can be cured, noting that these findings have no relevance to people who already have Type 1 diabetes.
hypothesis: Njengabanye ochwepheshe, uyangabaza ukuthi kungenzeka yini ukuphulukiswa kwesifo sikashukela, ephawula ukuthi lokhu okutholakele akunandaba nabantu asebevele benesifo sikashukela sohlobo 1.
corrected_ref: Njengezinye izazi, unokungabaza ukuthi isifo sikashukela singalashwa, ephawula ukuthi lokhu okutholakele akubathinti asebevele benesifo sikashukela soHlobo loku-1.
justification: The MT inaccurately translates "have no relevance to people" as "akunandaba nabantu" (have no interest/concern with people), which changes the original meaning. The correct reference uses "akubathinti" (do not affect them/are not relevant to them). Additionally, the phrase "kungenzeka yini ukuphulukiswa kwesifo sikashukela" for "whether diabetes can be cured" is less natural and more convoluted than the reference's direct translation "ukuthi isifo sikashukela singalashwa".

source: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.
hypothesis: NgoMsombuluko, uSara Danius, ongunobhala ohlala njalo weKomiti kaNobel Yezincwadi e-Swedish Academy, wamemezela esidlangalaleni ngesikhathi senhlelo yomsakazo eSveriges Radio eSweden ukuthi ikomiti, engakwazi ukufinyelela kuBob Dylan ngokuqondile ngokuwina uMklomelo kaNobel wezincwadi ka-2016, yayishiye imizamo yayo yokufinyelela kuye.
corrected_ref: NgoMsombuluko, uSara Danius, unobhala wesikhathi sonkeweKomidi leNobel for Literature eSwedish Academy, umemezele obala phakathi nohlelo lomsakazo eSveriges Radio eSweden ikomiti, njengoba lingakwazi ukufinyelela kuBob Dylan ngokuqondile mayelana nokunqoba Umklomelo weNobel weZincwadi ka-2016, liyeke imizamo yokumfinyelela.
justification: The MT uses the past perfect tense ("yayishiye") for "had abandoned," while the correct reference uses the simple past tense ("liyeke"). Although the MT's tense aligns with the source, the evaluation is against the provided 'Correct Reference.' Additionally, the MT's phrasing for "permanent secretary" ("ongunobhala ohlala njalo") is less idiomatic than the reference's "unobhala wesikhathi sonke." The construction "yokufinyelela kuye" for "to reach him" is also less idiomatic and concise than the reference's "yokumfinyelela."

source: Danius said, "Right now we are doing nothing. I have called and sent emails to his closest collaborator and received very friendly replies. For now, that is certainly enough."
hypothesis: UDanius wathi, "Manje asenzi lutho. Ngishayele ucingo futhi ngathumela ama-imeyili kumuntu owayesebenza naye futhi ngathola izimpendulo ezinobungane kakhulu. Okwamanje, lokho kwanele".
corrected_ref: UDanius wathi, “Okwamanje asenzi lutho. Sengishayele ucingo ngaphinde ngathumela ama-imeyile kwabasondelene naye kakhulu asebenzisana nabo futhi ngathola izimpendulo ezinobungane. Okwamanje, lokho ngokuqinisekile kwanele.”
justification: The MT hypothesis contains several inaccuracies. It translates "Right now" as "Manje" (now) instead of the more precise "Okwamanje" (right now/for now). More significantly, it translates "his closest collaborator" as "kumuntu owayesebenza naye" (to the person who was working with him), which is singular and implies a past action, rather than accurately conveying the sense of 'closest collaborator' as plural and continuous collaboration (as in the reference's 'kwabasondelene naye kakhulu asebenzisana nabo'). Additionally, the MT omits the word "certainly" from "that is certainly enough," losing a crucial part of the original meaning.

source: Previously, Ring's CEO, Jamie Siminoff, remarked the company started when his doorbell wasn't audible from his shop in his garage.
hypothesis: Ngaphambilini, umphathi omkhulu weRing, uJamie Siminoff, waphawula ukuthi inkampani yaqala lapho insimbi yakhe ingezwakali esitolo sakhe egaraji.
corrected_ref: Phambilini, isikhulu esiphezulu sakwa-Ring, u-Jamie Siminoff, sathi le nkampani yaqala ngenkathi kungezwakali ukuthi kukhona ongqongqozayo emnyango uma esesitolo sakhe esisegalaji lakhe.
justification: The MT fails to accurately convey the meaning of 'his doorbell wasn't audible from his shop in his garage.' It translates 'doorbell' literally as 'insimbi yakhe' (his bell), which is less natural and less specific than the descriptive phrase used in the reference ('kukhona ongqongqozayo emnyango' - 'someone knocking at the door'). More critically, the MT's 'ingezwakali esitolo sakhe egaraji' implies the bell wasn't audible *at* his shop in the garage. In contrast, the source implies he couldn't hear it *while he was in* his shop, which was located in his garage. The reference accurately captures this by using 'uma esesitolo sakhe esisegalaji lakhe' (if he was in his shop, which is in his garage).

source: He built a WiFi door bell, he said.
hypothesis: Wathi wakha ucingo lomnyango lwe-Wi-Fi.
corrected_ref: Wakhe insimbi yasemnyango yeWiFi, washo.
justification: The MT mistranslated 'door bell' as 'ucingo lomnyango', which means 'door wire' or 'door phone/cable'. The correct translation for 'door bell' is 'insimbi yasemnyango', as provided in the reference. This constitutes a significant word choice error that changes the meaning of the object built.

source: Siminoff said sales boosted after his 2013 appearance in a Shark Tank episode where the show panel declined funding the startup.
hypothesis: USiminoff uthe ukuthengisa kukhuphuke ngemuva kokuvela kwakhe ngo-2013 ku-Shark Tank episode lapho iphaneli yombukiso lenqabile ukusiza ukuqala.
corrected_ref: USminoff uthe izintengo zanyuka ngemva kokuvela kwakhe embukwisweni we-Shark Tank ngo-2013 lapho iphaneli yohlelo yenqaba ukusekela ibhizinisi ngezimali.
justification: The MT translates "funding the startup" as "ukusiza ukuqala," which means "to help the startup" or "to help to start." This omits the crucial financial aspect of "funding," leading to a significant loss of meaning compared to the source. The correct reference provides a more accurate translation with "ukusekela ibhizinisi ngezimali" (to support the business with funds).

source: In late 2017, Siminoff appeared on shopping television channel QVC.
hypothesis: Ngasekupheleni kuka-2017, uSiminoff wavela esiteshini sethelevishini sokuthenga i-QVC.
corrected_ref: Ekupheleni kuka-2017, iSiminoff savela ohlelweni lokuthengisa lukamabonakude iQVC.
justification: The MT provides an accurate and grammatically correct translation of the source text. It correctly uses the class 1 prefix 'u-' for the proper noun 'Siminoff' and maintains subject-verb agreement ('wavela'). The phrase 'shopping television channel' is appropriately translated as 'esiteshini sethelevishini sokuthenga'. The provided reference contains a grammatical error by using 'iSiminoff' instead of 'uSiminoff' for a person's name, which consequently affects the verb agreement ('savela').

source: Ring also settled a lawsuit with competing security company, the ADT Corporation.
hypothesis: I-Ring yabuye yaxazulula isimangalo nenkampani yezokuphepha eyayincintisana nayo, i-ADT Corporation.
corrected_ref: U-Ring wabuye waxazulula icala nenkampani ancintisana nayo yezokuphepha, i-ADT Corporation.
justification: The MT has two main errors. Firstly, for 'Ring', it uses the prefix 'I-Ring' (class 9) instead of the grammatically correct 'U-Ring' (class 1, often used for proper nouns/company names acting as subjects), as seen in the reference. Secondly, and more significantly, it translates 'lawsuit' as 'isimangalo' (claim/petition) instead of 'icala' (case/lawsuit), which is the more accurate term as used in the reference. This constitutes a word choice error that impacts the precision of the legal term. Additionally, 'eyayincintisana nayo' (which was competing with it) is past tense, while 'ancintisana nayo' (which competes with it) from the reference, or 'ecintisana nayo' (competing with it) would better reflect the meaning of 'competing' in the source.
